abstract: Arrest of New York State Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver on corruption charges has brought chaos to beginning of Gov Andrew M Cuomo's second term, greatly complicating his ambitions for state; episode also brings renewed attention to shutdown of anticorruption Moreland Panel in 2014.
lead_paragraph: The arrest of the New York State Assembly speaker is threatening to upend the order that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo spent his first term in the capital working to restore.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and SUSANNE CRAIG

snippet: The arrest of the New York State Assembly speaker is threatening to upend the order that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo spent his first term in the capital working to restore.

keywords.value: Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption (NYS)
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Sheldon Silver’s Arrest Leaves Governor Cuomo in Difficult Spot
headline.print_headline: Speaker’s Arrest Is Leaving Cuomo in Difficult Spot
